page.title: 11Biography of the Vicar
page.content: Rev.McAdam was born in 1915 during the First World War.His father was a schoolmaster in Belfast.He lived in Morecambe until he was five years old when his family moved to Cowbridge in Wales. He left Grammar School in 1933 and studied Latin,Greek and Philosophy in Aberystwyth University.He then went to Oxford to study for his M.A.and from there to Cardiff Theological College for eighteen months.He then worked for a builder for a year mainly working on air raid shelters. In 1941,Rev.McAdam moved to Bedwas, his first parish.After three years he went to Pontnewynydd and in 1950 he became Vicar of Skenfrith and Rector of Grosmont,where he lives. He still helps with building repairs in the two churches and has built a house for his retirement this year.
